oai_dc:dc.dc:title: American Y.M.C.A. 1918 Mother’s Day Pamphlet
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A pamphlet issued to U.S. Army soldiers by the Y.M.C.A. for Mother’s Day, contains a picture on the cover, several poems, and a letter from a mother to her son. In May 1918, more than a million deployed troops wrote letters to their mothers. They were put on the fastest ships and sent to the United States--all had “Mother’s Letter” written in place of a stamp. The World War I, also known as the First World War or the Great War, was a global war centered in Europe that began on 28 July 1914 and lasted until 11 November 1918. Forms part of the Clarence L. Alford Collection, Box 5: Song Lyrics. 1 booklet.
